meanings.definition: A thin, flexible disk or membrane, especially in the body.
meanings.sent1: The diaphragms in our body help us breathe by moving up and down.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes need to repair damaged diaphragms to ensure proper lung function.
meanings.sent3: When the singer laughed so hard, it felt like her diaphragms were vibrating with joy.
meanings.sent4: The diaphragms of the camera lens opened wide to capture the stunning sunset.
meanings.sent5: In yoga class, we learned to engage our diaphragms for deep breathing exercises.

meanings.definition: A contraceptive device consisting of a flexible dome-shaped cup.
meanings.sent1: She decided to use diaphragms as her preferred method of birth control.
meanings.sent2: The nurse explained how to insert and remove diaphragms for effective contraception.
meanings.sent3: At the pharmacy, they had a variety of colorful diaphragms on display.
meanings.sent4: Her diaphragms were always kept clean and stored properly to maintain their effectiveness.
meanings.sent5: The diaphragms were a discreet and reliable form of contraception for many women.
